events.name: Build Google Assistant Actions
events.description:
Join us as we learn how to build actions using the Google Assistant. The Google Assistant is the technology that powers devices like the Google Home, and the built in Google Assistant on Android devices.

Agenda:
7:00pm - 7:15pm - Networking
7:15pm - Intro
7:20pm - Building Conversational Experiences with Actions on Google
7:50pm - Codelab
8:30pm - Create Actions for your Community (Team Activity)
9:00pm - Wrap Up

PLEASE NOTE: You will need to bring your laptop.

LASTLY: Unfortunately, we can not validate parking.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam!

Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

There will be second meetup to continue this study jam in November. Keep a look out for that event soon.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
6:30pm: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
6:40pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1
8:30pm: Event ends

events.name: The Windsor-Essex DevFest - SOLD OUT :)

venue.name: Institute for Border Logistics and Security

events.description:
SOLD OUT

The Windsor Google Developers Group (GDG) is proud to host the first ever Windsor-Essex DevFest on Saturday, Feb 23, 2019 at the Institute for Border Logistics and Security in Windsor, Ontario. Check out all of the details here: https://goo.gl/f7pxWd

What is a DevFest?
DevFests are Google sponsored software developer conferences that allow the local software development community to come together to network and learn about the coolest new technology out there.

What can you expect at the Windsor-Essex DevFest?
A day full of great talks on some of the latest Google technology out there with great opportunities to network within the local tech community. Breakfast and lunch will be provided as well as a end of day prize raffle of some cool technology. We will be charging a small fee of $10 to help offset the cost of the conference (thanks to our sponsors for helping to cover the rest of the costs :).

What technologies will we be covering?
Some of the coolest development technologies out there including Flutter, TensorFlow, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

MORE INFO CAN BE FOUND HERE: https://goo.gl/f7pxWd
events.how_to_find_us: windsor tensorflow google machine learning flutter serverless gcp

events.name: Flutter and Firebase - like peanut butter and chocolate for mobile development
events.description:
****PLEASE NOTE: We changed the date from Thursday, May 2, 2019 to Wed, May 15, 2019. Apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused****

Flutter is an awesome way to quickly build a mobile app for both Android and iOS based on one codebase. Add on top of that the services offered by Google's Firebase tools and you can build mobile apps with all of the backend services you would expect in modern mobile apps - realtime databases, user authentication, push notifications, and A/B testing.

For the past month, Don Ward has been digging into integrating Flutter apps with all of the Firebase services available as he partakes in the #100DaysofCode challenge. During this event, you will learn how to build mobile apps using Flutter backed with Firebase services and how they work with Flutter mobile apps. Some of the Firebase services we will cover include:

1. Realtime Databases
2. Firebase's Firestore Database
3. Push Notifications on Firebase
4. Mobile App Analytics
5. Machine Learning services on Firebase (ML Kit)
6. A/B testing for mobile apps
7. Remote Config of your mobile app using Firebase
8. Google Cloud Functions and how they can be used to glue it all together

Join us to learn how to easily build a powerful mobile app using Flutter backed with a ton of great services from Firebase.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The Agenda for the Evening

6:30pm - 7:00pm - Networking/Food and Beverages (free food!)
7:00pm - 7:45pm - Flutter with Firebase talk by Don Ward
7:45pm - 8:00pm - Break
8:00pm - 8:30pm - Wrap up and demo's

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

events.name: A hands-on Intro to TensorFlow 2.0 with Josh Gordon, Google Developer Advocate
events.description:
***We will be meeting in Room 320***

TensorFlow is one of the most active open source machine learning projects in the world and powers a lot of Google's Machine Learning products.

Join us as Josh Gordon, Google Developer Advocate, talks about what TensorFlow is and how to get started. In this one hour tutorial, we will briefly introduce TensorFlow 2.0, then dive in to training neural networks. This tutorial is targeted at folks new to TensorFlow. It helps if you have prior machine learning experience, but you can still follow along if not. Attendees will need a laptop with an internet connection, there is nothing to install in advance. The goal of our tutorial is not to teach you everything you need to know (of course, it's lightening fast!) but to get you started. We will aim to work through a couple Jupyter notebooks.

About Josh
Josh Gordon works on the TensorFlow team at Google, and teaches Applied Deep Learning at Columbia University and Pace University. He has over a decade of machine learning experience to share. You can find him on Twitter at https://twitter.com/random_forests.

~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~~^~^~^~^~^~

Schedule for Evening

6:30pm - 7:00pm - Networking and food (free food will be provided)
7:00pm - 8:00pm - Intro to TensorFlow 2.0 with Josh Gordon
8:00pm - 8:30pm - Questions and Networking

~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~^~~^~^~^~^~^~

Parking

Unfortunately we can not validate parking.

A map of available parking at St Clair College can be found here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nA7DuAJEf60cFnHlh1v4glL6avJArUS3/view?usp=sharing

Due to construction the main Visitor lot is closed (LOT T). The best alternative for visitor parking is Lot H (the small “s” indicates a pay machine). Other lots marked with a “star” are also available for visitor parking.

upcoming.name: Firebase with a Googler
upcoming.description: For our Nov 2019 meeting we are excited to welcome a Google expert on Firebase. Firebase is Google's backend services to help you quickly make your mobile and web app ideas a reality. With 18 services ranging from a realtime database, push notifications, and machine learning models, Firebase has everything you need. Additionally, 1.5 million apps currently use Firebase, so you know it is production proven.

group_profile.intro: Don Ward is a co-lead of the Detroit Google Developers group - a software development user group focused on everything from Google. An avid tech enthusiast, he has been leading user groups in the Detroit area for the past 10 years.
